Title: Evaluation of IT Governance on Core Banking System Development Project Using Framework COBIT 5: Case Study at PT Bank KEB Hana Indonesia
Source title: 1st 2018 Indonesian Association for Pattern Recognition International Conference, INAPR 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Information System Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, Doctor of Research in Management, BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Aprilia, V.R., Information System Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Harisno, Information System Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kusumawardhana, V.H., Management Department, Doctor of Research in Management, BINUS Business School, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: PT Bank KEB Hana Indonesia is one of the banking companies that is experiencing rapid development in Indonesia. In running its business processes, PT Bank KEB Hana Indonesia promotes Information Technology (IT) to fulfill its vision, mission, and business objectives and operational services to customers. Therefore, IT governance needs to be implemented properly to provide good results for the company's achievements. The purpose of this research is to evaluate the maturity level of IT Governance at PT Bank KEB Hana Indonesia to measure IT governance in the core banking system development project. Evaluation was measured using the Process Assessment Model (PAM) of the COBIT 5 Framework which refers to 9 selected COBIT 5 processes namely EDM02, APO04, BAIO1, BAI02, BAI04, BAI05, BAI06, BAI08, and DSS03. Data collection used in this research is primary data obtained through interviews and questionnaires, and secondary data through observation stages. Data was analyzed with COBIT 5 Framework through 8 questionnaires retrieved from respondents using Rating Scale Formulas to find out the Capability Level scale for each Activity and Output in the selected COBIT 5 process. From the evaluation results, it is known that 9 processes are still at Level1 (Performed) where the results are still below the expected Capability Level, that is Level 4 (Predictable). So that the Gap Analysis obtained is 3, then the results are used to establish improvement recommendation based on Framework COBIT 5. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Capability Level; COBIT 5; IT Governance; Process Assessment Model (PAM)
Index Keywords: Pattern recognition; Surveys; Business objectives; Capability Level; COBIT 5; Evaluation results; Improvement recommendations; IT governance; Operational service; Process assessments; Online systems

Authors: Silvia, Rukmana P., Aprilia V.R., Suhartono D., Wongso R., Meiliana
Title: Summarizing text for indonesian language by using latent dirichlet allocation and genetic algorithm
Source title: International Conference on Electrical Engineering, Computer Science and Informatics (EECSI)
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, K.H. Syahdan 9, KemanggisanWest Jakarta  11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Silvia, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, K.H. Syahdan 9, KemanggisanWest Jakarta  11480, Indonesia; Rukmana, P., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, K.H. Syahdan 9, KemanggisanWest Jakarta  11480, Indonesia; Aprilia, V.R., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, K.H. Syahdan 9, KemanggisanWest Jakarta  11480, Indonesia; Suhartono, D., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, K.H. Syahdan 9, KemanggisanWest Jakarta  11480, Indonesia; Wongso, R., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, K.H. Syahdan 9, KemanggisanWest Jakarta  11480, Indonesia; Meiliana, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, K.H. Syahdan 9, KemanggisanWest Jakarta  11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The number of documents progressively increases especially for the electronic one. This degrades effectivity and efficiency in managing them. Therefore, it is a must to manage the documents. Automatic text summarization is able to solve by producing text document summaries. The goal of the research is to produce a tool to summarize documents in Bahasa: Indonesian Language. It is aimed to satisfy the user’s need of relevant and consistent summaries. The algorithm is based on sentence features scoring by using Latent Dirichlet Allocation and Genetic Algorithm for determining sentence feature weights. It is evaluated by calculating summarization speed, precision, recall, F-measure, and some subjective evaluations. Extractive summaries from the original text documents can represent important information from a single document in Bahasa with faster summarization speed compared to manual process. Best F-measure value is 0,556926 (with precision of 0.53448 and recall of 0.58134) and summary ratio of 30%. © 2014, Institute of Advanced Engineering and Science. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Automatic Text Summarization; Extractive Summaries; Genetic Algorithm; Latent Dirichlet Allocation; Sentence Features
